definition: variant of 施與|施与[shi1 yu3]
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: By applying pressure on a pedal, the brakes are applied.
sentences.chinese: 藉由對一個踏板施予壓力，剎車被應用。

sentences.english: When be friended, remember it:When you befriend, forget it.
sentences.chinese: 當你給別人施予友善時，要忘記它。

sentences.english: The apostle Paul describes generosity, or giving, as an act of grace.
sentences.chinese: 使徒保羅形容慷慨或施予是一種恩典的行爲。

sentences.english: She is the Dispenser of boons and the Dispeller of fear.
sentences.chinese: 她是恩惠的施予者和恐懼的驅除者。

sentences.english: We learned lessons about humanity, about giving, about receiving, about service above self.
sentences.chinese: 我們從人性，施予，收受及超我服務等方面學習經驗。

sentences.english: He also blesses us with spiritual gifts and empowers us to yield the fruit of the Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 他施予我們屬靈的恩賜，並幫助我們結出聖靈的果子。

sentences.english: May you share freely, never taking more than you give.
sentences.chinese: 願你寬心與人分享，所取不多於你所施予。

sentences.english: It enriches those who receive, without impoverishing those who give.
sentences.chinese: 它使獲得者蒙益，施予者也無損失。

sentences.english: Do not offer a compliment and ask a favor at the same time. A compliment that is charged for is not valuable.
sentences.chinese: 在對他人讚美的同時，不要向他人要求施予恩惠。

sentences.english: He did not treated as coronary disease untill this May.
sentences.chinese: 直到今年五月他才被施予心臟疾病的治療。

definition: to donate/to give/to grant/to distribute/to administer
to do good works/to be merciful
to confer a favor on sb/to confer a benefit
